io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets

Class TextTable.LayoutBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets.TextTable.LayoutBuilder
  • Enclosing class:
    TextTable

    public static class TextTable.LayoutBuilder
extends Object

    Provides a nice and compact DSL to build a set of columns for a table.

    A known limitation is that layouts built with this builder will be isomorphic with the data rows (i.e. you can't have a 3 column layout, displaying 1st, 15th and 8th value of the data row). While technically achievable, I don't see the point, so if you need it feel free to extend this builder or write your own.

        @NotNull
public @NotNull TextTable.LayoutBuilder column(@NotNull
                                                        @NotNull String columnName,
                                                        @Nullable

        Adds a column to the right, with the desired name and configurable attributes, displaying the next data index.
        Parameters:
        columnName - the name of the new column
        config - a function that can configure the column. If null or missing, the default attributes will be used.
        Returns:
        reference to this for chaining.
        See Also:
        column(String, Consumer)

      • getAllColumns

        @NotNull
 @Contract(pure=true)
public @NotNull Map<String,TextTable.Column> getAllColumns()
        Direct method to access all columns, can be used as lower level API to add and remove configured columns or to inspect and change their configuration.
        Returns:
        a map from column name to a column, ordered by their displayed order.

      • withData

        @NotNull
 @Contract(pure=true)
public @NotNull TextTable.DataBuilder withData()

        Create a strict data builder with the specified layout, that is used to build the data rows for the table. Each row should specify non-null values for all non-defaulted columns, and no extra data.

        The layout of the data builder is decoupled from this builder. This builder is still valid after creating a layout and can be used to create multiple layout objects.

        Returns:
        the data builder.
        See Also:
        TextTable.DataBuilder.buildTable()

      • withDataRelaxed

        @NotNull
 @Contract(pure=true)
public @NotNull TextTable.DataBuilder withDataRelaxed()

        Create a lenient data builder with the specified layout, that is used to build the data rows for the table. Each row should specify non-null values for all non-defaulted columns, but it may as well specify extra data.

        The layout of the data builder is decoupled from this builder. This builder is still valid after creating a layout and can be used to create multiple layout objects.

        Returns:
        the data builder.
        See Also:
        TextTable.DataBuilder.buildTable()
